result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Georgie Lopez Velez

records.addlTxt:
11:13 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Georgie Lopez Velez in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Georgie Lopez Velez.  Victims appeared in Court.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
The Court will adjourn.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS MODIFIED 10/06/2022:  If defendant has a passport, he is to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226).

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant states he does not have a passport.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A/Victim B/Victim C listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS immediately after court today (10/06/2022) and is to return to courtroom SC1009 right after to show GPS has been installed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant

Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022.

8:56 AM Defendant Georgie Lopez Velez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim C and Victim Dappeared in court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022.  Victim C presents a statement to the Court.  Victim D does not wish to present a statement today.  Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant states he does not have a passport.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant to report to WCS immediately after court today (10/06/2022) and is to return to courtroom SC1009 right after to show GPS has been installed.  Court would allow bail to be readdressed once counsel has been appointed.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.


Case recalled at 10:08 am.  Defendant Georgie Lopez Velez in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  The deputy was able to confirm the defendant does have the GPS monitor equipped.  The Court is satisfied the defendant has complied with the Court's order to install GPS monitoring.  Next date remains as previously set.  

If the defendant has a passport, he is to surrender the passport.  Court will modify bail and defendant to sign a new bond.
Filed by the defendant - will address at next hearing
